Dear Heather L Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Christopher M Barr, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member made verbal threats to physically harm youth and
referenced gang involvement. Staff member used profanity while
making the threats towards youth. Youth does not feel safe.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 09/01/2023. It states Staff Person 1 made
verbal threats to physically harm Youth A and referenced gang
involvement. Youth A does not feel safe, and Staff Person 1 has
been reassigned to another building. Complainant is the facility
Chief Administrator and provided no additional information.
Interviews:
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 09/07/2023 with DHHS Worker.
His statement was read to him as noted below in the
Documentation section and states it is accurate. He reported
previously on an unknown date that Staff Person 1 showed Youth
A a bullet hole in his arm and informed Youth A how seriously he
takes the streets noting how much of a gang-banger Staff Person
1 is. Youth A then reported that on 08/31/2023 that Staff Person 1
informed him that Staff Person 1 is one of the biggest Crypts and
called Youth A, “A (expletive) (expletive) 17-year-old.” Youth A
said Staff Person 1 told him he would show up in the parking lot
the day Youth A turned 18. Youth A said he believed Staff Person
1 meant to kill him.
I interviewed Youth B onsite on 10/25/2023. His statement was
read to him as noted below in the Documentation section and
states it is accurate. Youth B reports Youth A and Staff Person 1
were going back and forth and that both were cussing at each
other. Youth B does not report Staff Person 1 ever making gang
related threats or referencing gang-like activities as Youth A
reports during the incident in the day room or at any other time on
the unit.
2

I interviewed Youth C onsite on 10/25/2023. His statement was
read to him as noted below and states it is accurate. He adds that
Youth A and Staff Person 1 were going back and forth and
cussing. Youth C does not report Staff Person 1 ever making gang
related threats or referencing gang-like activities as Youth A
reports during the incident in the day room or at any other time on
the unit.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 via telephone on 09/19/2023. He
reported being employed as a direct care worker for six years and
is up to date with training requirements. He said Youth A was
upset with him for sanctions that got placed on him. Youth A then
began swearing at Staff Person 1 because Youth A felt like he
didn’t deserve them. Staff Person 1 reported he did have a back-
and-forth conversation with Youth A and notes they both had an
aggressive tone. Staff Person 1 states he did not use profanity
with Youth A and denies calling Youth A a, “(Expletive)
(expletive”). Staff Person 1 adamantly states that he has no gang
involvement and has never discussed gang-like activities with the
residents. Staff Person 1 went on to state how he grew up in a
Christian home and that the scar on his arm came from a burn
and not a gunshot wound.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 via telephone on 09/18/2023. She
reported Youth A got upset after Staff Person 1 gave him
consequences for a rule infraction. Staff Person 2 reported she
does not recall ‘the verbiage used” but stated that the language
used by Staff Person 1 was not appropriate. She did not report
Staff Person 1 threatening Youth A and has no knowledge of Staff
Person 1 having any gang-affiliation or mentioning gang-affiliation
in front of the youth.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 onsite on 09/19/2023. He reported
upon entry onto the J-Down dayroom that Staff Person 1 was not
saying anything, and that Youth A was stating that Staff Person 1
just called him a “(Expletive expletive) little boy”. He reported
Youth A was then escorted back to the unit. He did not report
having any knowledge of Staff Person 1 having any gang-
affiliation or mentioning gang-affiliation in front of residents.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 via telephone on 09/25/2023. He
reported upon entering the dayroom that Youth A was stating, “So,
I’m a little (Expletive)” and kept mentioning how staff should not
discipline him in front of other residents. Supervisor 2 then
reported Youth A was escorted back to the unit. Supervisor 2
3

reported he does not have knowledge of Staff Person 1 having
any gang-affiliation or mentioning gang-affiliation in front of
residents.
Video Review:
I reviewed video surveillance of the J-Down dayroom at 8:00pm
on 08/31/2023. It shows nine residents sitting with Youth A
standing and facing Staff Person 1 who is sitting. Staff Person 2
is present and is also sitting. Youth A becomes somewhat
animated and then Staff Person 1 stands up. Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 enter the dayroom and escort the nine residents out
of the dayroom and then begin talking to Youth A who eventually
exits the dayroom as well.
Documentation:
I reviewed Youth A’s written statement dated 08/31/2023. It states
staff was mad and gave me days (consequences) and the two had
words. Staff called him a “(expletive) (expletive) little boy” and to
“(Expletive) me”. Supervisors didn’t do anything, and he wants to
press charges because he feels unsafe in a place where staff are
supposed to keep us safe.
I reviewed Youth B’s written statement dated 08/31/2023. It states
Staff gave Youth A a two-day sanction. Youth A gave feedback
and staff fed into it. Staff could have handled it a lot better in his
opinion. If you swear at a juvenile, you should expect us to react
in the same way.
I reviewed Youth C’s written statement dated 08/31/2023. It
states Youth A got upset for “getting days” (sanctions) and that
Staff Person 1 told Youth A “(Expletive) you” at which point a code
was called and when walking out heard someone say they would
“Beat Youth A’s (Expletive)”.
I reviewed Youth D’s written statement dated 08/31/2023. It
states Staff Peron 1 saying to Youth A, “I’m not about to argue
with no (expletive expletive) 17-year-old boy”. Youth A responded
with, “Don’t talk to me like that. Who the (expletive) do you think
you talking to?” Staff Person 1 responded, “You soft (expletive)
little boy. I will beat your ass. (Expletive) you.”
I reviewed the facility’s merit system rule violation policy. It states
verbal and physical abuse or improper treatment of an inmate,
patient or client of any County institution or department is a merit
system violation of rule. It then notes the Child Caring Institutions
Intervention standards and prohibitions rule.
4

Staff Person 1’s personnel record indicates being hired in
10/2017, receiving orientation, and is up to date on his training
requirements.
Another State of Michigan department did not have any findings.
Analysis There is ample evidence to conclude that Staff Person 1 did use
profanity directed at Youth A. Youth A, other residents present,
and Staff Person 2 reported Staff Person 1 used inappropriate
language. There is no evidence to indicate Staff Person 1
threatened Youth A with gang-affiliation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2022C0217061 initiated on 09/12/2022; CAP approved 11/30/22

Upon receipt of an approved corrective action plan no change to the current license
